Author: ComputerGenie ğŸ‘´ğŸ¼ğŸ“¢#7004
Content:
short of physically having all 3, and having them all actively trading, USD/BTC/KMD is a false representative of USD/KMD
especially when markets diverge or return to equilibrium
There's less than 40% of the time where it's a valid calculation (this is doubly true when FUD or unicorns farting rainbow blows BTC/USD up or down)

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: I used to convert all the currencies to virtualized aggregates and then used the ratio of those as the price

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: that is not the usage

Content: the point is to be able to get as clean a signal out of the available time series data

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you need to filter out the noise

Author: ComputerGenie ğŸ‘´ğŸ¼ğŸ“¢#7004

Author: Matthias#2174
Content: I honestly don't see the issue with that. The fact that you cannot immediately sell KMD for USD at the price provided by the proxy chart, doesn't make the chart invalid or unreliable.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: price is not a fixed point anyway, it is more like a wave function

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: different probability of being different price at any moment in time

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: lower and lower probability the further out you go, but this is why sometimes you see flash crashes and fat fingers

Author: ComputerGenie ğŸ‘´ğŸ¼ğŸ“¢#7004
Content:
`The fact that you cannot immediately sell KMD for USD at the price provided by the proxy chart, doesn't make the chart invalid or unreliable.`
Actually, it means exactly that
If chart Y says that CoinX has the USD value of $1 and CoinX actually has more or less buying power than $1 then the chart is factually and measurably inaccurate

Author: ComputerGenie ğŸ‘´ğŸ¼ğŸ“¢#7004
Content: people tend to forget that CoinX is a currency

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if the charts purpose is to extract the signal with least noise, then it is quite valid.

Author: Matthias#2174
Content: Depends what you want to do with the chart. Since they tend to be more reliable than /BTC pairs, I will stick with that.
